recipe_text: Vegetable-Burger Soup. Brown 1/2 lb ground beef lightly in a soup pot and drain excess fat. Add 2 cups water, 1 can stewed tomatoes, 1 can tomato sauce, 1 package onion soup mix, 1 package frozen mixed vegetables, 1 teaspoon sugar, and simmer for 20 minutes.
raw:
{
  "title": "Vegetable-Burger Soup",
  "ingredients": ["1/2 lb ground beef", "2 cups water", "1 can stewed tomatoes", "1 can tomato sauce", "1 package onion soup mix", "1 package frozen mixed vegetables", "1 teaspoon sugar"],
  "steps": ["Brown 1/2 lb ground beef lightly in a soup pot and drain excess fat.", "Add 2 cups water, 1 can stewed tomatoes, 1 can tomato sauce, 1 package onion soup mix, 1 package frozen mixed vegetables, 1 teaspoon sugar, and simmer for 20 minutes."]</s>

recipe_text: Sesame Chicken Wings. Whisk together 3 1/2 Tbsp. light soy sauce, 1/2 garlic clove (minced), 1/2 tsp. minced fresh ginger, 1 Tbsp. honey, and freshly ground black pepper to taste, add 2 lb. chicken wings with wing tips cut off and toss to coat, marinate covered and chilled for 2 hours, line a pan with foil and arrange wings drained in one layer reserving the marinade, brush with 1 Tbsp. Oriental sesame oil, sprinkle with 2 Tbsp. sesame seed toasted lightly, and bake at 400° for 30 to 35 minutes basting occasionally with the reserved marinade until browned (serves 4 as an hors d'oeuvre).
raw:
{
  "title": "Sesame Chicken Wings",
  "ingredients": ["2 lb. chicken wings with wing tips cut off", "3 1/2 Tbsp. light soy sauce", "1/2 garlic clove", "1/2 tsp. minced fresh ginger", "1 Tbsp. honey", "Oriental sesame oil", "2 Tbsp. sesame seed", "freshly ground black pepper"],
  "steps": ["Whisk together light soy sauce, minced garlic, minced ginger, honey, and freshly ground black pepper.", "Add chicken wings and toss to coat.", "Marinate covered and chilled for 2 hours.", "Line a pan with foil and arrange wings drained in one layer.", "Brush with Oriental sesame oil.", "Sprinkle with toasted sesame seed.", "Bake at 400° for 30 to 35 minutes basting occasionally with the reserved marinade until browned."]</s>
